name: Analyse du temps de t√¢che : Aper√ßus automatis√©s des d√©passements de temps pour ClickUp et plus
description:
Ce flux de travail analyse automatiquement les t√¢ches pour d√©couvrir pourquoi le temps r√©el pass√© d√©passe les estimations initiales. Il se connecte √† ClickUp (peut fonctionner avec n'importe quel PMS comme JIRA, Asana, Monday et plus) et d'autres outils de gestion de projet pour g√©n√©rer des aper√ßus clairs sur les tendances de d√©passement. Gagnez du temps, am√©liorez la pr√©cision de la planification et augmentez la productivit√© de l'√©quipe avec une analyse automatis√©e du temps de t√¢che avec deux types de rapports.

- **‚ÄúPourquoi du temps suppl√©mentaire √©tait-il n√©cessaire ?‚Äù** ‚Äì Raisons pour lesquelles les utilisateurs ont demand√© des prolongations ou ont rencontr√© des obstacles.

- **‚ÄúPourquoi le temps estim√© a-t-il √©t√© d√©pass√© ?‚Äù** ‚Äì Raisons pour lesquelles le travail r√©el a d√©pass√© l'estimation initiale.


# üîß **Aper√ßu du flux de travail**

1. **D√©clencheur manuel**
Lancez l'ex√©cution en cliquant sur **‚ÄúTester le flux de travail‚Äù.**

2. **R√©cup√©rer les t√¢ches pertinentes**
Appelle ClickUp pour r√©cup√©rer toutes les t√¢ches dans les √©tats sp√©cifi√©s (‚Äúr√©vision interne‚Äù ou ‚Äúen cours‚Äù) qui appartiennent √† des dossiers et des assign√©s d√©sign√©s.

3. **Filtrer par d√©passement**
Filtre les t√¢ches pour inclure uniquement celles o√π time_spent > time_estimate.

4. **Rassembler les d√©tails**
Pour chaque t√¢che en d√©passement :
	- R√©cup√©rer **les entr√©es de temps** via l'API ClickUp.
	- R√©cup√©rer **tous les commentaires**, y compris les r√©ponses en fil.
	- Conserver uniquement les champs de t√¢che essentiels et reformater les horodatages.

5. **Normaliser et fusionner**
- Extrait et trie les fils de commentaires en tableaux propres.
- Trie les intervalles d'entr√©e de temps chronologiquement.
- Fusionne les m√©tadonn√©es de t√¢che, les commentaires et les entr√©es de temps en une seule charge utile.

6. **Transmettre √† l'agent IA**
Envoie les donn√©es de t√¢che consolid√©es √† un n≈ìud aliment√© par ChatGPT en utilisant un prompt personnalis√© qui :

	- Extrait **toutes** les ‚Äúdemandes de temps suppl√©mentaire‚Äù des commentaires et des entr√©es de temps.
	- Identifie les intervalles de **d√©bogage**, **recherche**, **clarification** ou **retravail** d√©passant les estimations.
	- Combine les r√©sultats en deux listes de contr√¥le distinctes.

7. **Formater la sortie JSON**
Un n≈ìud de code final analyse la sortie de l'IA en un tableau JSON propre pr√™t pour la conversion.

8. **Convertir en fichier**
Le r√©sultat JSON pour chaque t√¢che est pr√©par√© pour une pi√®ce jointe de fichier ou un stockage externe.


## üß© N≈ìuds et fonctions cl√©s

|Nom du n≈ìud|Responsabilit√©|
|-|-|
|Obtenir les t√¢ches ClickUp|R√©cup√®re les t√¢ches par crit√®res de filtre|
|Si la t√¢che a d√©pass√© l'estimation|S'assure que seules les t√¢ches avec des d√©passements continuent|
|R√©cup√©rer les entr√©es de temps via les ID de t√¢che|R√©cup√®re les intervalles de temps d√©taill√©s|
|R√©cup√©rer les commentaires principaux|R√©cup√®re tous les commentaires et fils|
|Diviser‚ÄØ‚Üí‚ÄØFusionner les n≈ìuds de script|Nettoie et normalise la structure des commentaires|
|Modifier les donn√©es de temps/t√¢che|√âlaguer et pr√©parer le JSON pour le traitement par l'IA|
|Mod√®le de chat OpenAI + Agent IA|Applique un prompt bas√© sur GPT pour g√©n√©rer deux listes de contr√¥le raisonn√©es au format JSON|
|Convertir en fichier|Pr√©pare la sortie finale sous forme de fichier JSON ou stocke sur un tableau ou un e-mail ou Excel|


## üõ† Conseils de personnalisation
- **D√©clencher l'automatisation :** Int√©grez un n≈ìud programm√© pour des ex√©cutions p√©riodiques (par exemple, quotidiennement).
- **Filtrer la port√©e :** Ajustez les filtres ClickUp pour diff√©rents types de t√¢ches, espaces ou statuts.
- **Ajustement du prompt IA :** Affinez le prompt pour inclure la gravit√©, des r√©f√©rences de lien ou cat√©goriser les raisons.
- **Gestion de la sortie :** Utilisez le fichier JSON dans les n≈ìuds n8n suivants pour des notifications *(Slack, Email, Spreadsheet, Airtable, ExcelSheet, etc.)* ou des analyses.

## ‚úÖ Avantages en un coup d'≈ìil

- Automatise l'analyse des d√©passements de temps, √©liminant la r√©vision manuelle.
- Extrait des aper√ßus directement des descriptions de t√¢ches, des commentaires et des feuilles de temps.
- Produit des sorties structur√©es id√©ales pour les tableaux de bord de gestion ou les r√©trospectives.
- Personnalisable pour des flux de travail ou des besoins de reporting sp√©cifiques √† l'√©quipe.



## üîê Informations d'identification API n√©cessaires
Vous devrez cr√©er une cl√© API de votre compte ClickUp. Suivez le document d'instructions n8n ici ++*https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/clickup/*++ cela vous guidera sur la fa√ßon de connecter votre compte ClickUp avec le flux de travail n8n.


# üë®üèª‚Äçüíª Besoin d'aide ?

Contactez www.KrupalPatel.com pour un support et le d√©veloppement de flux de travail personnalis√©s.

Trouvez plus de flux de travail n8n pour des cas d'utilisation r√©els ici : ++*https://n8n.io/creators/krupalpatel/*++

workflow.name: Insight of Overspent time on the task

parameters.content:
Why requested for extra time?

Checklist Name = Why needed Extra time?

List of reasons with the comment link if possible.

Why goes over estimation.

Checklist Name = Why goes over estimation?

Evaluate comments and discussions and based on that prepare list of reasons about why it goes over estimation.

parameters.content:
## Fetch Overtime Tasks

Pull ClickUp tasks in target statuses and folders with time_spent > time_estimate.

## Get Time Entries  
Fetch time entries for each task to analyze where time was spent.

## Get Comments and Its threads
Pull all user comments and thread replies from ClickUp.

## AI-Generated Checklist
 
Send task data to GPT to extract two reason lists (extra time + overrun reasons).

## Time spent on 
1) Development   
2) Scoping 
3) Commenting+Call+Documentation  
4) PR Review  
5) QA  
6) and miscellaneous time

parameters.text:
=TASK INFO
---------
taskId: {{$json.id}}
taskName: {{$json.name}}
textContent: {{$json.text_content}}
status: {{$json.status.status}} (type: {{$json.status.type}}, color: {{$json.status.color}})
tags: {{ JSON.stringify($json.tags) }}

timeEstimate: {{$json.time_estimate}}
timeEstimatesByUser: {{ JSON.stringify($json.time_estimates_by_user) }}
timeSpent: {{$json.time_spent}}

COMMENTS
--------
comments: {{ JSON.stringify($json.comments) }}

Each comment object includes:
- id
- comment_text
- date
- user (id, username)
- reply_count
- comment_thread (array of replies)

‚Üí You must analyze the full thread of each comment (main + replies) to extract **literal**, factual insights only.

TIME ENTRIES
------------
timeEntries: {{ JSON.stringify($json.time_entries) }}

Each time entry includes:
- user (id, username)
- time
- intervals (each with start, end, time, description, tags)

YOUR TASK
---------
You must determine **if and why** more time was needed or estimates were exceeded, **based only on literal phrases present in the data**. Do **not infer** or invent. Follow these strict rules:

1. **Analyze COMMENTS**
   - Extract a reason only if you find an **exact statement** such as:
     - Request for more time
     - Mention of blockers
     - Delays due to clarifications or product change
     - Rework initiated from comments
   - Ignore comments like: ‚ÄúPR created‚Äù, ‚ÄúDone‚Äù, ‚ÄúTested‚Äù, ‚ÄúReviewed‚Äù, or ‚ÄúAdded field‚Äù unless they **explicitly mention a delay or blocker**.

2. **Analyze TIME ENTRIES**
   - Extract reasons only if **descriptions or tags** mention:
     - Debugging, research, clarification, or rework
     - A specific delay reason like ‚ÄúAPI didn‚Äôt respond‚Äù or ‚ÄúIssue with X logic‚Äù
   - If interval notes are vague or missing, ignore them.

3. **Build Checklist Output**
   - If no factual, literal reason is found from either comments or time entries, return the following fallback result:

```json
[
  {
    "taskId": "{{$json.id}}",
    "check_list": [
      {
        "check_list_name": "why_needed_extra_time",
        "check_list_items": [
          "Not enough data available to determine why extra time was needed."
        ]
      },
      {
        "check_list_name": "why_gone_over_estimate",
        "check_list_items": [
          "Not enough data available to determine why the estimate was exceeded."
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
]

DO NOT skip this fallback. It is mandatory if data lacks solid insights.

CHECKLIST WRITING RULES
------------------------
The checklist must contain **short, meaningful bullet points**, not copied sentences or chat-style remarks.

Examples:
‚ùå "I need 10hr extra on top of spent time to..."
‚úÖ "Requested 10 additional hours due to technical differences in extension vs DA frontend."

‚ùå "During the demo we noticed a bug..."
‚úÖ "Bug identified during demo required a workaround due to Chrome extension restrictions."

‚úî Each checklist item must be:
- Condensed to a few words or a sentence
- Free of filler phrases like "I noticed", "we saw", "I need", etc.
- Framed as standalone explanations ‚Äî useful even when seen alone
- Group similar reasons (e.g., debugging multiple issues = one bullet on extended debugging)
- Start with verbs when possible: ‚ÄúRequested‚Äù, ‚ÄúDebugged‚Äù, ‚ÄúReworked‚Äù, ‚ÄúIntegrated‚Äù, ‚ÄúAdjusted‚Äù, etc.

DO NOT:
- Copy-paste comment text
- Repeat multiple versions of the same cause
- Include vague, conversational, or non-actionable text

Strict Rules:
-------------
1. ‚ùå **Do not infer**, assume, or fabricate any reasons.
2. ‚úÖ Extract a reason only if it is **clearly stated** in:
   - a comment or its replies (e.g., "need more time", "blocker found", "needs rework")
   - a time entry description (e.g., "debugging API issue", "researching logic")
3. ‚õîÔ∏è Ignore vague or default phrases like "work done", "tested", "code pushed", etc.
4. ‚úÖ If no valid reasons are found in a section, insert this **mandatory fallback reason**:

"Not enough data available to determine why extra time was needed."
or

"Not enough data available to determine why the estimate was exceeded."
You MUST include these fallback messages if no real reasons are found. Do NOT return an empty checklist.

OUTPUT FORMAT
Return only the raw JSON object in this format (no quotes, markdown, or stringification):

[
{
"taskId": "{{$json.id}}",
"check_list": [
{
"check_list_name": "why_needed_extra_time",
"check_list_items": [
/* factual reasons based on real comment or entry content ‚Äî or fallback if none /
]
},
{
"check_list_name": "why_gone_over_estimate",
"check_list_items": [
/ factual reasons based on real comment or entry content ‚Äî or fallback if none */
]
}
]
}
]
DO NOT wrap the result in quotes or return it as a string. Just return pure raw JSON array as output.

parameters.jsCode:
// Function node: ‚ÄúBuild Prompt With time_entries + Keyword‚ÄëCount + Resources‚Äù
const timeEntries = $input.first().json.time_entries || [];

let msg = { prompt: '' };
const rawJson = JSON.stringify(timeEntries, null, 2);
const taskInfo = `**TASK INFO**  
${rawJson}`;

const instruction = `You are a Time‚ÄëTracking Categorization Agent.  
You must process an array of users‚Äô intervals and assign each interval to exactly one category using **keyword match counting**.

---

### CATEGORIES & KEYWORDS  
(Case-insensitive, substring match on description or tags.)

- Development:      development, dev, feature, implement, coding, build  
- PR Review:        review, pr, merge, approve  
- QA:               qa, test, bug, verify, validate  
- Scoping:          scope, estimation, plan, analy  
- Commenting+Call+Documentation: comment, comments, call, calls, documentation, docs, doc  
- Miscellaneous:    (fallback ‚Äî when no keywords match)

---

### PROCESS PER INTERVAL:
1. Combine description and tags into a single string.  
2. Count keyword matches for each category.
3. Assign the interval to the category with the **most matches**.  
4. Break ties by choosing the category with the **alphabetically first name**.  
5. If no keywords match, assign to **Miscellaneous**.  
6. **Each interval must appear in only one category.**

---

### OUTPUT RULES:

- For each user:
   - Group intervals by category.
   - Include exact intervals as an array under \`resources\`.
   - Set the "time" field strictly by summing time_in_minutes from each item in resources.
   - Format it as Xh Ym (e.g., 1h 45m).
   - You must not guess, round, or calculate it separately.   
  - Format the total as ‚ÄúXh Ym‚Äù.
   - Omit any category with 0 total time.

---

### OUTPUT FORMAT:

Respond with only the final JSON array (no markdown or code fences):

[
  {
    "user": "<username>",
    "time_spent_by_category": [
      {
        "category": "Development",
        "time": "Xh Ym",
        "resources": [<interval objects>]
      },
      {
        "category": "PR Review",
        "time": "Xh Ym",
        "resources": [...]
      },
      ...
    ]
  },
  ‚Ä¶ more users ‚Ä¶
]`;


msg.prompt = [instruction, taskInfo].join('\n\n');
return msg;

user.name: Krupal Patel
user.bio: With having Lifelong Passion for Software Development. With over 15 years of experience, I've had the privilege of working with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and enterprise giants like Stryker Corporation, Ulta Beauty, Pepsico, Infosys, Fossil, and Bosch. My journey has been about taking complex projects from concept to market delivery, contributing to the success stories of these organizations.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
